author: PaulHigin
body: The ISE would be a much better debugging environment if it provided Variable and Callstack windows.  It would also be good to have a separate Output window for capturing output.  Currently everything is routed to the ISE console window and the information gets confused in the different spews.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PaulHigin probably better to open this issue here https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShellEditorServices/issues

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: PSES is UI agnostic.  It is meant to be used as a "backend" service for various editors (eventually).  Unfortunately, I think the only place for ISE feedback ATM is UserVoice.  https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell/category/148050-ise-and-tooling

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: At this point, there are no plans to add features to ISE (ISE can't be Open Source nor cross platform).  Our strategy is to improve Editor Services and integration (primarily VSCode at the moment) to address experience gaps.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Ok.  I'll close this issue for ISE.

title: Update ISE to include windows for local variables and callstack during debugging
